The comparison of 1H and 13C NMR signals for 5-alkynyl-2′-deoxyuridines is summarized in the Supporting Information of ref. [16].
For example, see:

Data for other compounds are reported in the Supporting Information. Excitations/emissions maxima (λex=295 nm) measured for other compounds (H2O/DMSO 1:1, 22 °C) were: 4, 369/435; 5, 364/409; 7, 397/456; 8, 370/445.

A one-exponential fit gave a lifetime of 3.4 ns with χr2=5.2. The three-exponential fit produced components τ1=1.0 ns (37 %), τ2=3.7 ns (38 %), and τ3=3.7 ns (25 %) and did not improve (χr2=3.8) over the two-exponential fit.
Efforts to dissolve a sufficient amount of 5 in the EPR matrix were unsuccessful.
The C2′ signal was obscured by the solvent resonance.

Although 13C-1H-coupled NMR (gated decoupling) spectra were acquired, we were not able unambiguously assign all J values and signals. Due to repeated atom numbers in both nucleoside components, labeling from the X-ray structure was used for signal assignments.
